storyInfo: After a falling-out with her sister, Loughshinny fails in her attempt to dispel the violet flames. Brigid wants to leave the city and go elsewhere, but gets stuck outside its gates. Dublinn, who should be upholding order in the city, only exacerbates the crisis.

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Sorry.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Ma'am! Hold on, please!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Oh, Reed! It's you! You left so suddenly—I was worried our hospitality had been lacking in some way.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: No, I truly appreciated your hospitality. I had just suddenly remembered some business I had to take care of. I still have a few questions, though. Would you mind answering them for me?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Ask away.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Do you realize that you're engulfed in flames?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Flames? Oh, you mean my blessing? Wow, you can see other people's blessings?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident
Loughshinny
attributes.content: I didn't notice until someone pointed it out to me—

attributes.name: Loughshinny
attributes.content: Wait, you're saying you know about the flames, but can't see them? How can that be?
The friendly resident puts her hand on her waist.
The ancient Tarans carried small flames at their waists, stabilized through Originium Arts, to dispel the dark mist in the marsh.
After Victoria seized full control of Tara, this custom—along with all similar practices—was strictly banned.
But times have changed. No longer bound by Victoria's rules, the Tarans, or at least the people of Na Saoirsí, have chosen to wear small Originium lamps at their waists.
I'm sure you know fuel is scarce, and with the curfew in place, we can't afford to keep the lamps on—nor do we need to. But... if we carry these small lamps...
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: That's her fire... That's the color of her fire in the lamp.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Now, whenever people turn on their lamps, this is the color they'll see. Even if they replace the filaments with different ones, the color remains unchanged.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: And you're not the least bit worried about this?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Well, as you can see, things are on the up and up here in Na Saoirsí. And what explanation can there be but the Red Dragon's blessing?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But?
But if a reckless returnee tried to warn her that those flames were anything but fortuitous, she would never believe it.
Loughshinny hopes that perhaps a more direct approach would work.
But I wanted to experience the dragon's blessing for myself. May I hold your hand?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But you've already entered the city. Everyone who does will receive the blessing, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Please? It's just a small favor.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Well, I suppose it wasn't easy for you to make it all the way back to Tara.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Oh, right, what do you do for a living, anyway?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: I... I know some basic medicine, along with some healing Arts. Nothing to brag about.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So you're a doctor, then. We're in need of doctors, actually.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Come here. Give me your hand—
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: She tightly clasps the woman's calloused hand, letting the fire spread from her own wrist to Loughshinny's.
Thank you...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She shuts her eyes.
Close your eyes and remember those whose pain you once soothed, those no longer forced to linger in this realm—
Go, and warm this cold fire.
Ugh...
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: The purple flames gradually fade. Beneath them, a pale face emerges, swaying gently, with a friendly smile.
So she tries to erase more of the purple flames, but fails to notice when the woman's expression suddenly changes.
My God, I—
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: My hand! What did you do to my hand?! It's completely numb!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny
Friendly Resident
attributes.content: I can't feel my blessing anymore, either! Just what are you doing to me?!

attributes.name: Friendly Resident
attributes.content: Let go!
Reed!
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: Wakewoman?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Reed, please let go of this poor lady.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: Sorry, ma'am.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: She means no harm—I stake my honor on it.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: But she said she's a doctor—how could a doctor possibly...?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Arts-based medicine can sometimes have side effects. Look at your hand, it's perfectly fine now, isn't it?
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: But I still can't feel anything—
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: You'll be fine.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: The wayward wakewoman raises a hand, gently pressing her warm palm to the frightened woman's forehead. It is just a normal, casual gesture, yet the woman gradually calms down.
Okay, okay. I believe you. Right, I still have my hand, as well as my blessing.
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: It's almost nightfall. You should head back home.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: And Reed, you have another banquet to attend, don't you?
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: A banquet?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...Right, the banquet.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So please, allow me to lead the way.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: Wakewoman, since you've returned, does that mean Moran and the others have already settled in?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: That's right. They'll be staying just outside the ruins. They're probably still clearing out the empty houses right about now.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Don't mention it. By the way, call me Nemos. I hardly do any work as a wakewoman these days.
attributes.name: The Wakewoman

attributes.content: Alright, Nemos. You mentioned a banquet just now. Who's hosting it?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: In a few days, Dublinn will be hosting a celebratory banquet, and all the high-ranking nobles will be in attendance, including Her Highness Eblana. We've been very busy with all the preparations.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: A celebratory banquet? While the residents are making do with 'stewed meat' and 'grilled fins' made from only potatoes?
attributes.name: Loughshinny
Nemos
attributes.content: The potato thing started out due to a food shortage, but now, they're just...

attributes.name: Nemos
attributes.content: used to it.
But Dublinn is aware of the situation in the city. They're calling it a 'banquet', but I didn't see any eating or drinking on the itinerary.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I'm not trying to cover for anyone, Miss Loughshinny. I truly believe that Dublinn wouldn't turn its back on the people of Tara like that.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Now if you'll excuse me, I must be going.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: She certainly left in a hurry.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So if directly removing the violet flames would only cause a panic, what if I were to do it more subtly...?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: To lunder whatever you want, then?
attributes.name: Voice from Behind

attributes.content: Who's there?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The noble red dragon turns around and sees a figure engulfed in blazing purple flames.

No, if the other residents have been merely 'kissed' by the flames, then the person standing before her seems to have been forged from the purple fire itself. The flames don't look harsh, yet they distort the very light around them.
Unfortunately, what you want sounds incredibly boring.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: After all, Tara's flames have already been dyed that color. That's just a fact.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: You know about the flames.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I happened to find out about them, yes.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Tell me everything you know. It's extremely important.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Why should I?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: I need to stop people from being engulfed by the purple flames.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So you can replace them with your own flames?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: As long as the people of the city are safe, the color doesn't matter.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What grandiose nonsense. It's almost nostalgic. Your excuse is so clumsy that it's laughable, red dragon.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: What is your relationship to my sister, sir?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Loughshinny takes a step forward, while the figure moves backwards, preserving the distance between them.
Relationship? You, your sister, and I are all cut from the same cloth. We all crave power, conflict, and bloodshed.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: We're all itching for what comes next, eager to set the land ablaze.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: But this time, I'll stay out of it. Until the Lair is consumed by flames, I'll be cheering on both sides.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Goodbye—
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Wait!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The red dragon tries to weave the flames of life into a cage, but before it can take shape, the strange figure scatters in the wind.
Her fire only briefly illuminated his long tail...
Then returned to nothingness.
Sir.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: It's you. What's wrong? Why have you come to see me now?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Don't tell me there's another problem with your grain shop that I have to deal with. I've never treated you as a subordinate—we're 'business partners', understand?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Good, as long as you do. I have another shipment that needs to be escorted out of the city. Leave soon, and be back before curfew.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Sir, about that—
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: About what?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: About the grain we sent out before... You said it wouldn't affect the city's food supply, but now we're all stuck eating only potatoes...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Do you know what it's like in other parts of Tara? They don't even have potatoes!
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Na Saoirsí's agricultural output is already top-tier. We're taking urgent measures to help our countrymen. Understand?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Besides, how much did you earn from just those last two carts?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Look at it this way: the people of Na Saoirsí aren't starving. At least they've got potatoes to fill their bellies.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: What's more, it's almost harvest time. There will be plenty of new grain then. I'm more worried that your tiny shop won't have the throughput to sell it all.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Still, I'm not one to force anyone to act against their conscience. If you really feel that bad about it, you can always just transfer your business license to someone else and close your shop.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: But how will I eat then?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: I told you, you're not my subordinate. How is that my problem?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Alright, alright, just hand over your business license by the end of the day—
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: No! Don't! Okay! I'll do it.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Why are you still standing there?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: I have something else to discuss. My friend told me that lately, the dark mist in the forest...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Dark mist? If I needed you to remind me about that, I might as well quit right now.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: There will be someone waiting for you once you're past the gates, just like always. Anything else is none of your concern. Now go.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Sir.
attributes.name: Frantic Soldier

attributes.content: What is it? Did The Brigadier say something when he was on patrol this morning?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: No sir, he didn't come around this morning. The Leader sent him on another assignment.
attributes.name: Frantic Soldier

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Then what's got you in such a panic?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: It's officially harvest season for the agricultural plate to the south.
attributes.name: Frantic Soldier

attributes.content: Isn't that a good thing?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Yes, but, uh, all the skilled agricultural workers have left the city.
attributes.name: Frantic Soldier

attributes.content: Tch, just follow the handbook—do exactly as it says, got it?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Yes sir!
attributes.name: Frantic Soldier

attributes.content: By the way, what's the estimated yield for the entire plate? Report it to me, and I'll consolidate the numbers later.
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Um, we're not exactly familiar with this sort of work either...
attributes.name: Frantic Soldier

attributes.content: You're useless! Can't you at least tell when the crops are ready for harvest?
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: They're definitely ripe, or we wouldn't have harvested them in the first place...
attributes.name: Frantic Soldier

attributes.content: Then isn't it just business as usual? Report a normal yield based on previous years! Now get going!
attributes.name: 'The Bureaucrat'

attributes.content: Hello, I'm Brigid the nomad.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What do you want?
attributes.name: Jittery Guard

attributes.content: I've delivered all my letters in Na Saoirsí. So I'd like to go to the highest point in the city and let the wind carry my message to my brothers and sisters. Then I'll be on my way.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ah, now I remember—it's you. You've been here so many times, and we've never let you up there even once. Haven't you learned your lesson yet?
attributes.name: Jittery Guard

attributes.content: Even the Victorians let me up to the top of the citadel when they were in charge.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Do I look like a Victorian to you?
attributes.name: Jittery Guard

attributes.content: No. You're a Taran.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Then you should know that, since we're all Tarans, there's no need to indulge those outdated customs of yours anymore. All that nomad and wakeman nonsense—it's all stupid superstition.
attributes.name: Jittery Guard

attributes.content: Now get moving! If you don't, I might just have you arrested!
attributes.name: Jittery Guard

attributes.content: Fine, I'm going. No need to make a fuss...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Welp, I've done exactly nothing I set out to do, other than delivering my letters.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Oh well. At least I'm out of the city before curfew. Now to just pass though the Dark Woods and I'll be back on the open plains.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: *Sigh*... I just hope the mist will let me through.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But it's never stopped the nomads before, so why am I worrying about it?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The nomad kicks a pile of fallen leaves by the roadside. The rustling sound echoes through the vast, empty forest ahead.
To her surprise, the sound doesn't fade away—it echoes back in a repeating loop.
Brigid suddenly crouches down, trying to cover the scattered leaves before her. Where the sound is coming from.
Sorry, shouldn't have kicked you.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The sound continues.
Uh—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: It doesn't stop. Instead it grows louder and louder, echoing until it becomes an unbearable, deafening cacophony.
At the same time, the dark mist creeps up from her feet, covering her eyes and ears.
Until she realizes she is back at the forest entrance.
....This is the fifth time!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Not going to let me leave? Really? Forcing me back into the city, is that it?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hmph. Well, I'm not going back.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I'll set up a tent outside the forest if I have to. I'll get my chance to leave, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Brigid
